name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Final Sign Off
Acceptance Criteria - All below requirements are met and approved by CR
Verifying Document - Referenced Item numbers as below
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Documentation review prior to installation
Acceptance Criteria - To comply with NZS 4058:2007. Designed and installed to NZS 3725 2007. Shall be class 4 unless noted otherwise on drawings.
3.1.4 - Manholes, Catchpits and Precast Concrete Structures
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Documentation review prior to installation
Acceptance Criteria - Precast structures to comply with NZS 3106. Joints to be interlocking, self centering type. Sealed with butyl mastic or similar approved.
○ Manhole rings to be minimum 1050mm diameter, ubnless otherwise stated & comply with NZS 4058.
○ In-situ RC to comply with Specification: Concrete (structural) & SPecification; Reinforcement.
○ Gratings, manhole lids and frames to be Class D complying with AS 3996, cast iron.
○ HD grates, lids and frames used in roadways, verges, sideways. Light duty elsewhere.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Documentation review prior to installation
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete work shall be in accordance with Section 410 of this Specification unless stated otherwise in the Specification and/or the Drawings.
○ Precast headwalls/wingwalls design drawings to be submitted for approval pre construction. Design to comply with project requirements and relevant NZS standards.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Documentation review prior to installation
Acceptance Criteria - Granular material to comply with grading as per NZS 3725.
○ Flexible pipe bedding to be AP5-20 or pea metal depending on pipe diameter, sand bedding allowed in sand enviroment.
○ Rigid pipe bedding, surround and haunching material to be as per drawings or AP20.
○ Material to be free from organic matter.
○ Grading curve formed for each material.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Documentation review prior to installation

Acceptance Criteria - Manufactured & installed to approved supplier recommendations. To be bolted to riser with SS bolts. Shop drawings to be approved prior to construction. Structure to consist of galvanised steel to NZS 4671 and galvanised to NZS 4680.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Design review
Acceptance Criteria - ER to provide sufficient design.
3.3 - Construction - In accordance with NZTA F/3 & NZS 3725
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Visual Inspection of pipes / precast structures upon delivery to site.
Acceptance Criteria - Visual check to ensure materials are free from cracks, gouges or other deformations that could be detrimental to the life of the product.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Onsite Setout
Acceptance Criteria - Survey have setout using pegs or similar, the location of the structure in regards to horizontal and vertical alignment, as per design.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Visual inspection of drainage trench to enusre correct grade as per design
Acceptance Criteria - Grade of trench to be constructed as per design drawings and complys with NZTA F/3.
○ The compacted trench base must have a dry denmsity of 95% standard compaction before placing bedding.
○ Where bottom of trench is existing ground, DCP test at 10m spacings prior to placing bedding. CBR > 2
Verifying Document - Site Inspection Form, DCP Test Results
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Visual inspection of completed drainage line including all attached structres
Acceptance Criteria - Engineer to inspect constructed drainage line for workmanship and defects prior to backfilling
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Visual inspection & density testing
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding material to be compacted to a density index of 70% or relative density of 95% OMC.
○ Minimum embedment zone as per table
Pipe OD mm || Bedding below base of pipe mm || Bedding above crown of pipe mm || Bedding either side of the pipe mm
Verifying Document - Test Record & Site Inspection Form
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check relevant to design
Acceptance Criteria - Constructed structures to be within design tolerence as per clause 402..4.3.
○ As-built data recorded and submitted to client.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pipes < 600mm diameter shall be hydrostatically tested and inspected by CCTV to identify any leaks or deficiencies in joints.
Acceptance Criteria - No leaks or joint deficiences within pipe effecting operation.
○ Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV) Inspection in accordance with the New Zealand Pipe Inspection Manual (latest edition).
Verifying Document - Testing certificate & CCTV Footage
